content: marker 2 let s go cast on using smaller needles and twisted german cast on method cast on 84 96 108 120 132 144 156 sts in c1 the twisted german cast on is very stretchy it avoids having a mark on your forehead after wearing the hat you can find a tutorial here https //www youtube com/watch v=owhrfvu5im0 however if you are not comfortable with it you can use any other cast on you like join for working in the round placing a marker to indicate the start of the round be careful not to twist your stitches on the first round ribbing with smaller needles *k1tbl p1* all around repeat until you reach about 2 5 2 7 3 3 5 4 4 5 4 5 cm / 1 1 1 1 2 1 4 1 5 1 8 1 8 inches knitting through back loop make the ribs more regular but if you are not comfortable with it you can use a classic *k1 p1* ribbing body switch to larger needles you are going to work with c1 c2 and c3 work the diagram - baby row 1 to 12 - toddler child teen adult adult large adult extra large row 1 to 24 after completing the diagram knit in c1 to reach 10 11 12 13 5 14 14 5 14 5 cm / 3 7 4 1 4 7 5 3 5 5 5 7 5 7 inches from cast-on you may already be at this length after the diagram crown set up row k14 16 18 20 22 24 26 pm r1 *k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 sm* - repeat to the end of the row 12 decreases r2 knit all around work r1 and r2 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 more times 24 sts left for all sizes next 2 rounds k2tog all around cut yarn leaving at least 15cm 6 inches pull yarn through remaining stitches to close the hat weave in ends on the inside add a pompom if desired 3 diagram 24 24 23 23 22 22 21 21 20 20 19 19 18 18 17 17 16 16 15 15 14 14 13 13 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5 4 4 3 3 2 2 1 1 4
